title: SYSTEMS ENGINEER 2 - TS/SCI with CI Poly.
description: In support of the Intelligence and Information Warfare Directorate Quick Reaction Capability (I2WD QRC) Branch applicant will perform as a SIGINT/HUMINT field service representative overseas supporting the AN/MSQ-148 or Vigilant Pursuit System. Required Qualifications: -Typically requires bachelor’s degree or equivalent and two to four years of related experience. - Active Top Secret/SCI Clearance (SCI within the last 2 years) - Advanced problem Solver - Comfortable working with soldiers - Experienced trouble shooter with advanced wireless, RF, network systems and other communication systems and data bases - Team Builder - Deployable Desired Qualifications: - Experience trouble shooting and repairing complex electro-mechanical systems, AC and DC power supplies and electronic components -Knowledge with Windows, Redhat, and CISCO OS Commands and network architecture - Experience configuring and maintaining COMSEC equipment - Experience configuring and maintaining VSAT equipment - Experience maintaining US Army SIGINT/HUMINT systems - Strong understanding of RF antenna theory, wave propagation, RF modulation and the RF Spectrum - BS in related engineering field

title: FCA Auditor - Network Administrator 3- TS/SCI with CI Poly.
description: ○ Performs functional configuration audits which ensure that functional and performance attributes of a configuration item are achieved (Trojan NEXGen). ○ Provides support of Electronic Warfare (EW) systems, receiver systems, and processing/storage subsystems at remote sites. ○ Hardware Support (design, layout, testing, installation, deployment, system administration and maintenance) of servers, workstations, printers and peripherals in Windows and Linux environments. ○ Network Engineering Support (LAN/WAN/ATM Engineering, monitoring, administration and tool deployment). ○ Software Support (database, applications development and maintenance, life cycle support web technologies, MS SQL Server). ○ Software Engineering Support (Documentation, testing, requirements analysis). ○ Responsible for maintaining the LAN operation infrastructure. ○ Administers system upgrades, system documentation, daily administration and problem resolution, as well as assisting staff in problem resolution relating to hardware, software, and communication issues. ○ Perform other duties as assigned.

title: Maintenance Team Leader - TS/SCI with CI Poly.
description: ○ Preventative Maintenance - Execute maintenance plan and ensure the application of resources to accomplish repairs. ○ Maintain site according to standards and specifications detailed in standing operating procedures. ○ Maintain safety standards for site equipment and team members. ○ Work with internal/external customers to meet objectives ○ Utilize initiative and influence to drive results and promote continuous improvement ○ Utilize expertise to solve problems, optimize systems, and plan for future requirements ○ Participate in meetings to support operational needs; utilize maintenance resources to develop plans for corrective action, and sustainable programs to reduce repeat failures. ○ Perform duties in preceding skill level and other duties as assigned. Supervisory Responsibilities ○ Provide a successful environment in which employee problems are recognized and responded to effectively, Daily Operations-supervision of maintenance employees, scheduling, employee development. ○ Setting an example of personal performance and integrity which encourages excellence. ○ Selects Technicians for the projects and provides training and coaching. ○ Provides feedback when results are at or below expectations and identifies key issues and provides a clear course of action. ○ Accomplishes the job in a timely manner, provides quality work and continually strives to increase technical, business, and interpersonal knowledge. ○ Ensure employees understand their responsibilities and performance expectations, were enabled to perform their jobs effectively and encourage to share and act upon their ideas for improvement. ○ Provide a successful environment in which employee problems are recognized and responded to effectively.

title: Senior Electronics Technician - TS/SCI with CI Poly.
description: ○ Maintenance of several hundred disparate US Army Electronic Warfare and Intelligence systems. ○ Applies advanced technical knowledge, along with military technical electronics knowledge, to fault isolation, scheduling and maintaining complex communications and electronics systems in accordance with Army and Department of Defense standards. ○ Performs critical quality and safety assurance reviews of all equipment integration practices to assure conformance with the US National Electrical Code (NEC). ○ Provides engineering input to the preparation of Engineering Change Proposals, (ECPs), and technical design packages. ○ Develops integration plans and performs hardware integrations, and manages documentation schematics and modifications. ○ Prepares site integration and test reports. Configures computer software, communications devices, and peripheral equipment to operate within designated networks. Designs and plans for and executes network hardware installation, testing, and validation. ○ Training military personnel at the installation site in proper use of highly specialized electronic equipment. ○ Prepares and maintains equipment and configuration documentation, and performs physical configuration audits. ○ Supports US Army systems on site whenever and wherever deployed. ○ Available to deploy to other countries and/or theaters to perform quick reaction technical support to US forces worldwide military contingency missions and requirements in potentially hazardous work environments. ○ Able to maneuver in small spaces and lift up to 75 lbs. ○ Able to perform all duties to ensure timely, courteous and quality support to INSCOM or other customers/affiliates of Genesis. ○ Perform other duties as assigned

title: Electronic Warfare/Intercept systems Integrator/Maintainer - TS/SCI with CI Poly.
description: MOS 33W, 35T Equivalent Skill Level 20 with the rank of Sergeant, 2005 -2006 ○ Performs duties shown in preceding skill level and provides mentoring and training to subordinate soldiers. ○ Serves as the quality assurance inspector for EW/I systems. Conducts and monitors formal and informal SOJT programs. ○ Prepares technical annexes for nit Standard Operating Procedures (SOP). Skill Level 10 is the basic entry level technician, 2002 - 2005 ○ Installed, operated, and maintained strategic and tactical satellite communications ground terminals, systems, networks, communication security (COMSEC) devices, and associated equipment. ○ Operates and performs preventive maintenance checks and services (PMCS) on assigned communications equipment, vehicles, and power generators ○ Meets TS(SCI) eligibility requirements. ○ Trained to perform maintenance tasks associated with electronic warfare equipment and systems. ○ Understands advanced electronic theory, advanced concept and troubleshooting theory to include basic and advanced computer concepts and advanced troubleshooting skills using the Army's most advanced EW systems. ○ Understands concepts for repair of analog and digital electronics, communications equipment (receivers, recorders, and multiplexer/de-multiplexers), transmission line repair techniques, computer architecture/operating systems fundamentals, automated messaging, and network operations/troubleshooting. ○ Has all the skills to repair and maintain virtually any electronic system from the tactical to strategic level. ○ EW/Intercept Systems maintenance concepts for organizational, direct and general support maintenance. ○ Performs or supervises unit, direct, or depot support and provides maintenance of Electronic Warfare (EW) subsystems, receiver subsystems, and processing/storage subsystems at fixed stations or remote sites.

title: Concierge - Helpdesk
description: ○ Managed maintenance, security, staff, key logging, database backups and physical security. ○ Exercises independent judgment in prioritization of incoming service calls. ○ Provides expert guidance in response to Tier I service support calls to the service desk. ○ Analyzes, recommends and implements system modifications to reduce user problems. ○ Supports incident management by providing problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution and follow-up steps. ○ Identifies, researches and resolves technical problems provided by users on a variety of technical issues. ○ Analyzes, logs and reports solutions to senior leadership in accordance with Service Level Agreements. ○ Analyzes and diagnoses problems by interviewing users. ○ Documents, tracks and monitors incidents from reporting to resolution. ○ Simulates user problems to resolve service difficulties.
